column4: Yeah, it's text-only. Trying to think of a GTK/QT front-end you could use.
There are a lot of front-ends to it, just trying to think of a general-purpose one for transcodes. Most are geared for DVD ripping and * --> MP4 as of late.
Wish I had a .swf file on hand to see if Avidemux will accept it or not. Only video editor I have on-hand.
Not sure, transcode utils might allow for.
Well, I know mencoder can do the job.
It's included when you install any 'mplayer' pkg.
i mean is this terminal program?
mencoder - MPlayer's Movie Encoder, this what apt search find,
